title.native: それいけ!アンパンマン

description:
One night, a Star of Life falls down the chimney of a bakery nestled deep in the forest, causing the dough in the oven to come to life. The dough becomes Anpanman, a superhero made of anpan (a sweet roll with bean jam filling). Together with his friends, Anpanman fights his rival Baikinman and helps the malnourished.

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)
A fast and highly regarded action animator. Friends with [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/) since their junior high school days.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Chom2Start)  |  [SOUL OF JOE (fansite)](http://soulofjoe.jp/index.html)

Currently working for Studio M2.

He's an Ashita no Joe ''collector'' and fan and has contributed to books, TV programs, museums and more. He is also an administrator of the fansite ''SOUL OF JOE''.

A Japanese poet, lyricist and translator. During his life, he wrote many lyrics for school songs (mainly for school in the Saitama area, in which he wrote more than 300) and nursery rhymes. He is also known for his adaptation of the "One Horse Open Sleigh" (popularly known as "Jingle Bells"), that despite being written at the end of the 50s, after became the part of the original soundtrack for [Ai Shoujo Pollyanna Monogatari](https://anilist.co/anime/2554/Ai-Shoujo-Pollyanna-Monogatari) started appearing regularly in animes, appearing in the likes of Sailor Moon, One Piece and Nogizaka Haruka no Himitsu. And became widely known after a clip of its usage in the PSP game Fate/Extra gone viral with the meme "Padoru, Padoru"
